column1: Task
Analyze evidence in laboratories, or in the field.
Analyze gunshot residue and bullet paths in order to determine how shootings occurred.
Arrange for the disposal of lead, asbestos and other hazardous materials.
Calibrate and test equipment, and locate circuit and component faults, using hand and power tools and measuring and testing instruments such as resistance meters and oscilloscopes.
Change logging operations or methods to eliminate unsafe conditions.
Collect evidence from crime scenes, storing it in conditions that preserve its integrity.
Collect samples of gases, soils, water, industrial wastewater, and asbestos products to conduct tests on pollutant levels and identify sources of pollution.
Compare objects such as tools with impression marks in order to determine whether a specific object is responsible for a specific mark.
Conduct materials test and analysis, using tools and equipment, and applying engineering knowledge.
Conduct pollution surveys, collecting and analyzing samples such as air and ground water.
Conduct postmortem studies and analyses to determine the causes of animals' deaths.
Construct, maintain, or repair medical supportive devices.
Cut and edit film or tape in order to integrate component parts into desired sequences.
Design and fabricate appliances, such as space maintainers, retainers, and labial and lingual arch wires.
Develop manufacturing, assembly, and fabrication processes of lasers, masers, infrared, and other light-emitting and light-sensitive devices.
Develop methods and apparatus for securing representative plant, animal, aquatic, or soil samples.
Diagnose and repair vehicle heating and cooling systems.
Diagnose faults or malfunctions to determine required repairs, using engine diagnostic equipment such as computerized test equipment and calibration devices.
Diagnose hardware and software problems, and replace defective components.
Diagnose mechanical problems and determine how to correct them, checking blueprints, repair manuals, and parts catalogs as necessary.
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve hardware, software, or other network and system problems, and replace defective components when necessary.
Evaluate the position of the wisdom teeth in order to determine whether problems exist currently or might occur in the future.
Examine and operate new equipment prior to installation in order to ensure that it performs properly.
Examine animals and specimens to detect the presence of disease or other problems.
Examine fire sites and collect evidence such as glass, metal fragments, charred wood, and accelerant residue for use in determining the cause of a fire.
Examine physiological, morphological, and cultural characteristics, using microscope, to identify and classify microorganisms in human, water, and food specimens.
Examine vehicles to determine extent of damage or malfunctions.
Induce changes in composition of substances by introducing heat, light, energy, and chemical catalysts for quantitative and qualitative analysis.
Inspect and test horses, sheep, poultry, and other animals to detect the presence of communicable diseases.

Inspect bridges, dams, highways, buildings, wiring, plumbing, electrical circuits, sewers, heating systems, and foundations during and after construction for structural quality, general safety and conformance to specifications and codes.
Inspect instructional equipment to determine if repairs are needed; authorize necessary repairs.
Inspect, operate, and test machinery and equipment in order to diagnose machine malfunctions.
Inspect, test, and listen to defective equipment to diagnose malfunctions, using test instruments such as handheld computers, motor analyzers, chassis charts, and pressure gauges.
Install or repair self-contained ground source heat pumps or hybrid ground or air source heat pumps to minimize carbon-based energy consumption and reduce carbon emissions.
Install robot and modify its program, using teach pendant.
Install, adjust, and operate electronic equipment used to record, edit, and transmit radio and television programs, cable programs, and motion pictures.
Install, service, and repair electronic equipment or instruments such as televisions, radios, and videocassette recorders.
Look for trace evidence, such as fingerprints, hairs, fibers, or shoe impressions, using alternative light sources when necessary.
Make and fit prosthetic appliances.
Modify electrical prototypes, parts, assemblies, and systems to correct functional deviations.
Note, mark, and photograph location of objects found, such as footprints, tire tracks, bullets and bloodstains, and take measurements of the scene.
Observe and listen to operating machines or equipment in order to diagnose machine malfunctions and to determine need for adjustments or repairs.
Operate equipment to demonstrate proper use and to analyze malfunctions.
Overhaul and test machines or equipment to ensure operating efficiency.
Paint a variety of objects related to electrical functions.
Perform tests on water, food and the environment to detect harmful microorganisms and to obtain information about sources of pollution and contamination.
Photograph crime or accident scenes for evidence records.
Plan layout and installation of electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures, based on job specifications and local codes.
Plan pipe system layout, installation, or repair according to specifications.
Read specifications such as blueprints to determine construction requirements and to plan procedures.
Rebuild gas or diesel engines.
Remove tumors and other abnormal growths of the oral and facial regions, using surgical instruments.
Search for and collect evidence such as fingerprints, using investigative equipment.
Set up and conduct chemical experiments, tests, and analyses using techniques such as chromatography, spectroscopy, physical and chemical separation techniques, and microscopy.
Suggest and apply the use of supports such as straps, tapes, bandages, and braces if necessary.
Suggest and apply the use of supports such as straps, tapes, bandages, or braces if necessary.
Test and adjust repaired systems to meet manufacturers' performance specifications.
Test drive vehicles, and test components and systems, using equipment such as infrared engine analyzers, compression gauges, and computerized diagnostic devices.
Test sites and materials to establish facts, such as burn patterns and flash points of materials, using test equipment.
Test soils and materials to determine the adequacy and strength of foundations, concrete, asphalt, or steel.
Troubleshoot fuel, ignition, and emissions control systems, using electronic testing equipment.
Tune automobile engines to ensure proper and efficient functioning.

Use a variety of specialized equipment such as electron microscopes, gas chromatographs and high pressure liquid chromatographs, electrophoresis units, thermocyclers, fluorescence activated cell sorters and phosphoimagers.
Use bonding technology on the surface of the teeth in order to change tooth shape or to close gaps.
Use electronic test equipment to locate and correct malfunctions in fuel, ignition, and emissions control systems.
